text: The Nitrosomonadaceae are a family of bacteria. They oxidize ammonia (NH3) to nitrate (NO3−).George M. Garrity, Don J. Brenner, Noel R. Krieg, James T. Staley: Bergey's manual of systematic bacteriology. Vol. 2: The Proteobacteria Part C: The Alpha-, Beta-, Delta-, and Epsilonproteabacteria. Springer, New York 2005, They are lithoautotrophic meaning they do not need organic substance to live. == Systematics == There are two genera:J.P. Euzéby: List of Prokaryotic Names with Standing in Nomenclature - Family Nitrosomonadaceae * Nitrosomonas * Nitrosospira ==References== Category:Gram-negative bacteria
title: Nitrosomonadaceae
